intro: Penianthus patulinervis, commonly known as the slender-leaved penianthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces small, oval fruits that are dispersed by wind. The plant is noted for its aromatic foliage, which contains compounds similar to those found in other members of its family.
